item.title: Cozy Butternut Squash Soup with Ginger and Sage for Fall Evenings
item.description: This butternut squash soup is the ultimate fall comfort food. With a hint of ginger and fresh herbs, it's warming and nourishing. Perfect for chilly evenings with loved ones! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 4 | #cat1761231766734 #Easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: 45 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 medium butternut squash, peeled and diced
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, grated
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 teaspoon fresh rosemary, chopped
  • 1 teaspoon fresh sage, chopped
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1/2 cup coconut milk (optional for creaminess)

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sautÃ© for about 5 minutes until softened.
  2. Stir in the minced garlic and grated ginger, cooking for an additional minute until fragrant.
  3. Add the diced butternut squash, vegetable broth, rosemary, and sage. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the squash is tender.
  4. Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth. If you prefer a chunkier texture, blend just half of it.
  5. Stir in the coconut milk for added creaminess, if desired, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  6. Serve hot, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh herbs or a drizzle of olive oil.

This recipe balances tart Granny Smith apples with warm spices and emerges from the waffle maker in about 30 minutes total. | â±ï¸ Prep: 20min | Cook: 15min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761230422512 #Mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking

item.title: Master Southern Thanksgiving Sides Like a Pro
item.description: Get ready to impress with these Southern Thanksgiving sides! From rich turkey gravy to flavorful cornbread dressing and perfectly caramelized sweet potatoes, each dish brings comfort to the table. Youâ€™ll wanna save this recipe for your next family feast! | â±ï¸ Prep: 30min | Cook: 60min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761229818868 #Mediumrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 30 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 60 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 4 cups cornbread, crumbled (I use Bob's Red Mill mix for the best texture)
  • 2 cups vegetable broth, low-sodium
  • 1 cup onion, finely chopped
  • 1 cup celery, finely chopped
  • 1 teaspoon sage, dried (or fresh if you can find it)
  • 1 teaspoon thyme, dried
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons Kerrygold butter
  • 3 cups sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
  • 1/4 cup brown sugar
  • 1/4 cup maple syrup
  • 2 cups turkey gravy, homemade or store-bought

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Alright, first things first - preheat your oven to 350Â°F. While thatâ€™s heating up, letâ€™s get your cornbread ready. If youâ€™re using Bob's Red Mill, prepare it according to the package instructions. You want it slightly dry.
  2. Next, grab a skillet and melt the Kerrygold butter over medium heat. Toss in your chopped onion and celery. SautÃ© for about 5-7 minutes until theyâ€™re soft and fragrant. Seriously, the smell is gonna make your kitchen feel like home!
  3. Now, in a large bowl, combine the crumbled cornbread, sautÃ©ed veggies, sage, thyme, and enough vegetable broth to moisten everything. You want it to be moist but not soggy. Add salt and pepper to taste. It should feel like a warm hug.
  4. Spread that mixture into a greased baking dish and cover with foil. Bake for 25 minutes. Then remove the foil and bake for another 15-20 minutes until it gets a nice golden crust. That crunch on top? So good.
  5. While thatâ€™s baking, letâ€™s tackle the sweet potatoes. Boil them in salted water until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and mash with brown sugar and maple syrup. You want them smooth but with a few chunks for texture. Trust me, this combo is a game changer!
  6. For the gravy, just heat it up in a saucepan until bubbling. Now, serve everything hot and watch it disappear faster than leftovers at a family gathering.
